Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2008 08:26AM nobleanna007 wrote: Flyrzfan,                 Hi I thought I would pop in and let you know I am also positive but I am triple positive with 5/27 nodes positive. I chose to have a bilateral masactomy because I am very fibercystic in both breasts and felt befor being diagnoised it was just a cyst that needed to be aspirated. My onc. feels its being growing for awhile and my surgery was not schedule until 3 weeks from diagnosis. They said don't stress its been there for awhile and awhile longer is not going to make that diffrence. Because you really need to think about whats best for you. My decesion was easy because of the cysts and I did not want to worry about it all the time. I had my surgery and reconstruction done at the same time. Unfortunatley I did have some problems with one expander and had it removed but I am still glad I chose it he will be able to fix after radiation. I am going through 4 rounds of A/C everyother week. Then I go on taxol with herceptin for 12weeks 1 aweek. Then rads and weekly herception shots which I have to have for 40 weeks. Long road but I am 43 and have young children and I really want to do everything I can!. I am also stageIIIa This time right now that your going through is the hardest and learning all tose terms and labs etc etc isvery overwhelming at times so post often and ask any question. Someone will always have a answer for you. And when you start chemo they usually have one going for that month and you really bond with these people cause at the same time you are doing it so are they and its nice talking with others like that. And they have great tips. I post on the Feb08 club so you can always find me there Take care and the best of luck to you!!!                                                    HUGS- Bridget

Low and behold it was CANCER Stage III so I just caution you that  sometimes like you have needed us will to and all we can is support that person whether its B9 or BC we hope for B9 for each of these people going through this and alot come out B9 but that did not stop us from reaching out. I know she has gone to alot of Drs. but she has not had the puzzel solved yet. I know I would and have done the same. I have been to every Dr. under the sun for lower back and leg pain. Yes I have neuropthy but as the neurolgist has said I am not having it in the normal ways which chemo causes. So on to a Rheum. No its not a autiomune disease. Been to a Ortho, No its not a bone or muscle related. My pain specialist said nerves are hard to treat and diagnose. This has ended me up in the hospital twice for 2-3 days at a time to get the pain under control. My back and legs look like I have been beaten severely cause I lay on heating pads. You can stick a needle in my leg and I can't feel it and the shock it. So no things are not easily solved. Do I still have my answer somewhat but not really!!!! I have always tried to help you Jenn and cared about you! And I feel its our turn to give back just my thoughts!!!!!! Good-luck Angel if you have any doctor appointments this week! We are rooting for you!                                               HUGS-Bridget

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 10:47AM nobleanna007 wrote: Deb,     You are on the exact path as myself. I had abraxne instead of Taxol cause the decadron they gave me the first few times of the A/C drove my blood pressure way up. Abraxne is a gentle type of Taxol I did really well on it and only had to do 4 TX instead of the 12 with Taxol. I think because I decided to have a bilateral is why they did not try to shrink the tumor first. It was pretty big. Where they have taken the lyphmnodes out make sure you ask them about Lymphedema and excersises to get your range of motion back. Cause you will need it for the Rads. I was not told and slipped through the cracks and my O/T was livid cause she says she works directly with clients after they have had that many nodes taken out and she was shocked I was not given any excersises. So if they don't bring it up ask about it. I really hope your lumpactomy works out for you. I also had that choice but due to very dense breast which was in both and also fibrocysts I elected to just taken them off. I seriously thought it was just a cyst that needed to be drained. I will never forget the look on the techs faces cause I went down to my small local hospital where everyone knows everyone and I knew by their faces. And the tears in their eyes.       And don't worry if you end up with a masactomy reconstruction has so many options. I am excited I am having a DIEP  and I will get a tummy tuck and new perky breasts to boot. Its a long procedure but they use your own fat which I have definatly have required since they have thrown me into menapause!!!!! 20lbs I can't believe it. Now when I quit smoking I know more will come on no matter if I live on carrott sticks!! LOL!!!!!!       Your Surgeon is full of B.S. It happens to people who don't smoke as it does for the ones like us who do. Is it better not to YUP!!! But you know what with all the stress and other stuff is it like you said better that you quit probably not and she or he should respect that. I had a failed expander and my smoking could have caused it but I know others that have had the same thing happen or worse and they didn't smoke so who the heck knows!!!!! And I am sorry if you feel more comfortable getting a masactomy then I would find another surgeon but if your okay with your decesion then stick with it. I don't understand that surgeons thought process they still have to go in there and cut it out whether its a lumpactomy or a masactomy you still will heal the same way regardless. Thats crazy!!!!       I am sorry that you had to learn on your daughters Birthday but look at it this way each year your NED you throw a double party in your honer also!! And you will have many! HUGS!!!!! Bridget

I just keep taking tylenol and if I need something stronger I have the tylenol 3 but so far so good. Alot better thenthe A/C so far. I will only have 3tx left yey!!!
